short_summary: Office renovations for rooms 115-116 in building M-32
description: To bid on this project all members of your company should have a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS), issued by the Canadian Industrial Security Directorate (CISD). AND also all persons who will be assigned to this project should hold a valid Reliability Status granted or approved by CISD. All members of your team should be available to sign a form of attendance proving that they attended this meeting. Failing to meet all of the above constrains will result in your bid being rejected. full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
## Project: M32 Rooms 115 & 116 Office Renovations

### Project Overview

The National Research Council Canada (NRC) has a requirement for a project that includes renovations to rooms 115 & 116 in building M-32, located at the Montreal Road Campus of the NRC.

### Bidding Requirements

To submit a tender for this project, interested bidders must obtain tender documents through the Buyandsell.gc.ca TMA services provider. Addenda will be available from the same source once issued. Firms should note that tender packages are not available for distribution on the actual day of tender closing.

### Mandatory Site Visit

It is mandatory for bidders to attend one of the site visits at the designated date and time. At least one representative from bidders intending to bid must be present. Site visits will be held on January 17th and January 18th, 2023, at 9:00 am. Bidders who cannot attend at the specified date and time will not be given an alternative appointment and their tenders will be considered non-responsive.

### Tender Closing Date and Time

The tender closing date is February 2nd, 2023, at 14:00. Tender results will be sent by email to all contractors who submitted a tender.

### Mandatory Security Requirement for Canadian Contractors

The contractor must, at all times during the performance of the contract, hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) issued by the Canadian Industrial Security Directorate (CISD). Contractor personnel requiring access to sensitive work sites must each hold a valid RELIABILITY STATUS granted or approved by CISD.

### WSIB (Workplace Safety and Insurance Board) Requirement

All bidders must provide a valid WSIB certificate with their tender or prior to contract award.

### Office of the Procurement Ombudsman (OPO)

The OPO was established by the Government of Canada to provide an independent venue for Canadian bidders to raise complaints regarding the award of federal contracts. Should you have any issues or concerns regarding the award of a federal contract, contact the OPO by email, telephone, or web.

### Contact Information

For any enquiries regarding this project, contact:

* Benoit Ranger, Departmental Representative
* Collin Long, Contracting Authority
